intro: Pterolepis sipaneoides, commonly known as the Sipaneoides pterolepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. This species is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile.
